  • Sort your table's data

    First Name Last Name Concept Rating AKA
    Tony Stark Marvel 42 Iron Man
    Jack Sparrow Disney 40 Pirate
    Bruce Banner Marvel 38 The Hulk
    Clarke Kent DC 35 Man of Steel
    Bruce Wayne DC 34 The Dark Knight
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious
    Captain America Marvel 39 Captain America
    Peter Parkar Marvel 43 Spidy
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious 
    	$('#sortMe').tableutils( {
		fixHeader: { width: 1000, height: 200 }, 				 
		sort: { type: [ 'alphanumeric', 'alphanumeric' , 'alphanumeric', 'numeric', 'alphanumeric'] }, 
		columns: [ 					   
			   { label: 'First Name' },
	           { label: 'Last Name' },
	           { label: 'Concept' }, 
	           { label: 'Rating' },
	           { label: 'AKA' }
	       	]
	} );

  • Search through your table

    First Name Last Name Concept Rating AKA

    	$('#searchMe').tableutils( {
		fixHeader: { width: 1000, height: 200 }, 				 
		filter: true, 
		columns: [ 					   
			   { label: 'First Name' },
	           { label: 'Last Name' },

  • Select records easily

    First Name Last Name Concept Rating AKA
    Tony Stark Marvel 42 Iron Man
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious
    Captain America Marvel 39 Captain America
    Peter Parkar Marvel 43 Spidy
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious
    Captain America Marvel 39 Captain America
    Peter Parkar Marvel 43 Spidy
    Tony Stark Marvel 42 Iron Man 
    	$('#selectMyRecords').tableutils( {
		fixHeader: { width: 1000, height: 200 }, 				 
		masterCheckBox: { columnIndex: 1 },  
		rowSelect: { columnIndex: 1 }, 
		columns: [ 
		       { label: 'ID' }, 
			   { label: 'First Name' },
	           { label: 'Last Name' },
	           { label: 'Concept' }, 
	           { label: 'Rating' },
	           { label: 'AKA' }
	       	]
	} );

  • Split your data into pages; Paginate your table.

    First Name Last Name Concept Rating AKA
    Tony Stark Marvel 42 Iron Man
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious
    Captain America Marvel 39 Captain America
    Peter Parkar Marvel 43 Spidy
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious
    Captain America Marvel 39 Captain America
    Peter Parkar Marvel 43 Spidy
    Tony Stark Marvel 42 Iron Man
    Sherlock Holmes Doyle 37 Ingenious 
    	$('#paginateMe').tableutils( {
		fixHeader: { width: 1000, height: 200 }, 				 
		paginate: { type: 'numeric', pageSize: 2 },				
		columns: [ 				       
			   { label: 'First Name' },
			   { label: 'Last Name' },
			   { label: 'Concept' }, 
			   { label: 'Rating' },
			   { label: 'AKA' }
			]
	} );


You may have some questions, like:

  • What if I want to use multiple features at once for a table ?

    Sure, you can use all of the features in a single table simultaneously. Refer the Documentation for the same.

  • I don't like the colors and styling of these tables. What do I do about it ?

    Hmm, neither do I; but hey i have kept this nice and simple. All you have to do is go to the tableutils.css file and change the styling of the table as per your requirement. This ensures you get something that matches the look and feel of your application. Great, isn't it ?
